channel.title: Historical biogeography on Gabriel Nakamura
channel.description: Recent content in Historical biogeography on Gabriel Nakamura

item.title: Herodotools: An R package to integrate macroevolution, community ecology,and biogeography
item.description: Abstract Historical processes like speciation, extinction and historical dispersal are the ultimate factors generating and maintaining biodiversity. Therefore, understanding how these factors affect the distribution of biodiversity is of great importance. To do so, it is necessary to integrate information from ancestral state reconstructions and current species distribution data and traits. Studies that integrated both information proved effective in unveiling questions in the intersection of macroecology, macroevolution, and community ecology.
